result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

3:12 PM Court Commissioner: Tim Heckmann, Reporter: UNMONITORED DAR. Clerk: K Kittel. Attorney Michael Joseph Becker in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Aaron James Morrison Esq appeared by video w/defendant Peter Michael Gulich Jr who also appears by zoom, both with permission of the Court. Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG.  Waives speedy trial.  Court advises DE of his right to be in person for this hearing. 2:14 PM Court Commissioner: Tim Heckmann, Reporter: Unmonitored DAR, Clerk: Benoy  Defendant Erin Elaine Burch in court.  Attorney Jeremiah James Harrelson in court for Erin Elaine Burch. Defendant Peter Michael Gulich Jr. in court.  Attorney Aaron James Morrison Esq in court for Peter Michael Gulich Jr.  Attorney Michael Joseph Becker in court for State of Wisconsin.    INCLUDES: 22CF517 & 22CF516    Attys agree to call cases together for the Preliminary Hearing only.  State calls SCCO Deputy Aaron Praschak.  Witness sworn. State direct.  Witness identifies DE Peter Gulich.  Witness identifies DE Erin Burch.  Atty Harrelson cross.  Atty Morrison cross.  Witness excused.  Argument by Atty Morrison.  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial.  Court confirms addresses.  Bonds continue.  Adjourned: 2:50

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant. 

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, A.A.F. or A.K.  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats. THIS CONDITION SHALL ONLY BE EFFECTIVE UPON THE EXPIRATION OF A 72 HOUR NO CONTACT ORDER.

Defendant to comply with any TPC disposition orders or protective plans regarding children.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

DE confirms address and DOB. DE understands charges and possible penalties. Waive reading. DE doesn't qualify for PD-PFAC given. Bond argument. Court orders bond. Court sets PH with Court Commissioner. Adjourned at 1:58 PM.  gll
